title: Remove ALL console.log statements from production code
description: Remove all console.log statements from production code that will spam user consoles. The extension currently has 20+ console.log statements across multiple files including React hooks and components.

acceptance_criteria.text: Remove all console.log statements from extension.ts
Remove all console.log statements from React components and hooks

title: Replace ALL 'any' types with proper TypeScript interfaces
description: Replace rampant use of 'any' types throughout the codebase with proper TypeScript interfaces. The codebase currently has TypeScript interfaces with [key: string]: any that completely defeat type safety, functions accepting 'any' parameters without validation, and no proper message typing between extension and webviews.

acceptance_criteria.text: Replace all 'any' types in useVSCodeMessaging hook with proper interfaces
Replace all 'any' types in useTaskInteractions hook with proper interfaces

title: Fix security vulnerabilities in dev dependencies (esbuild/vite chain)
description: Fix 4 moderate security vulnerabilities in dev dependencies (esbuild/vite chain). Security vulnerabilities in build tools can compromise the development environment and potentially affect production builds. These need to be updated to secure versions.

acceptance_criteria.text: Update esbuild to version without security vulnerabilities
Update vite and vitest to versions without security vulnerabilities

title: Fix ALL ESLint violations (12 errors, 19 warnings)
description: Fix all 31 ESLint violations (12 errors, 19 warnings) found throughout the codebase. Issues include unused variables and imports, prefer-const violations, no consistent error handling patterns, and try-catch blocks that only log errors without proper handling.

acceptance_criteria.text: Fix all 12 ESLint errors (unused variables, prefer-const violations, etc.)

title: Fix global mutable state in extension activation
description: Fix global mutable state in extension activation that creates race conditions and prevents proper cleanup or isolation between extension instances. The extension currently uses global variables for services and state that can cause issues when multiple instances are running.

title: Implement proper error handling with user feedback
description: Implement proper error handling with user feedback throughout the extension. Currently errors are logged but not properly handled, users get cryptic error messages, and there are no recovery mechanisms or proper error boundaries. Silent failures occur in critical paths.

title: Fix React hooks with side effects and improper patterns
description: Fix React hooks with side effects in render, improper dependency arrays, and direct DOM manipulation mixed with React. The hooks currently have console logging in production, side effects during render, and don't follow React best practices.

title: Fix unreliable file watching with proper debouncing and cleanup
description: Fix unreliable file watching that uses fs.watch which is unreliable across platforms. The current implementation has no debouncing for file changes, potential for infinite loops on file writes, and no proper cleanup of watchers.

title: Fix inconsistent data flow and race conditions in save operations
description: Fix inconsistent data flow and race conditions in save operations. The extension currently has multiple ways to update the same data, no proper state synchronization between panels, and queued operations that can fail silently.

title: Add proper input validation and sanitization for user data
description: Add proper input validation and sanitization for user-provided data. The extension currently has no input sanitization, file system operations without proper path validation, and potential for directory traversal attacks. Regex validation allows dangerous characters and has no length limits.

title: Add loading states and proper UX feedback for async operations
description: Add loading states and proper UX feedback for async operations. The extension currently has no loading states, synchronous operations blocking the UI, no proper feedback for long-running operations, and confusing error messages.

title: Fix broken type definitions that defeat TypeScript safety
description: Fix broken type definitions that defeat TypeScript safety. The codebase has type definitions with [key: string]: any patterns and other constructs that completely undermine TypeScript's type safety guarantees.
